An Inventory of Methods for Estimating C.description: provides a comprehensive overview of methods to integrate climate change into flood planning.

Maximum annual 1-day rain.description: describes maximum annual daily rainfall, which can be important for flooding of smaller creeks and watersheds.

Change in 1-in-50 year snow load.source: The Climate Resilient Buildings and Core Public Infrastructure Project
Change in 1-in-50 year snow load.description: describes changes in extreme snow loads, based on levels of global warming.

river and lake flooding.direction_statement: Climate change will cause changes to river and lake flooding severity and frequency that will depend very closely on location, season, and local watershed factors.
river and lake flooding.direction_confidence: It is difficult to make confident statements regarding the direction of climate-driven changes to river and lake flooding severity, without added local information about flood mechanisms and local watershed conditions.
river and lake flooding.magnitude_confidence: Because of local factors, estimating the magnitude of changes to river and lake flooding due to climate change is difficult without undertaking a detailed local assessment.
river and lake flooding.impact_statement: River/lake flooding has the potential to inundate nearby building interiors, erode foundations and surrounding property, and decrease user accessibility and even safety.
river and lake flooding.notes: If you are unable to undertake a more detailed climate change/flood assessment for your building, conservative approach that assumes that flooding will increase in severity and frequency may be safest option.

Change in 1-in-50 year annual 15 minute.source: The Climate Resilient Buildings and Core Public Infrastructure Project
Change in 1-in-50 year annual 15 minute.description: describes changes to the likelihood of rare short term and daily rain events.

extreme rain.direction_statement: Climate change is expected to cause extreme rain events to become more frequent and severe.
extreme rain.direction_confidence: There is high confidence that as temperatures increase, the magnitude of extreme rainfall will also increase.
extreme rain.magnitude_confidence: The exact magnitude of extreme rainfall increases may be somewhat uncertain, especially for high intensity, short duration rainfall events.
extreme rain.impact_statement: Extreme rain can directly damage building components through leaks and infiltration, and also inundate building interiors, erode foundations and surrounding property, and decrease user accessibility from rain-caused overland or flooding.

Change in 1-in-50 year snow load.source: The Climate Resilient Buildings and Core Public Infrastructure Project
Change in 1-in-50 year snow load.description: describes changes in extreme snow loads, based on levels of global warming.

extreme snow.direction_statement: Extreme snow accumulations over the winter season are likely to decrease in most areas of Canada, with the exception of the North.
extreme snow.direction_confidence: High confidence exists that in many locations, overall snowpack - including extremely high seasonal snowpacks - will decrease as temperatures warm and more precipitation falls as rain.
extreme snow.magnitude_confidence: Because change in snow accumulation depends closely on a combination of temperature and precipitation, the exact magnitude of changes to accumulation over time, and in some places, even uncertainty around the direction of change.
extreme snow.impact_statement: Extreme snow can stress roofs and decrease user accessibility.
extreme snow.notes: Need an assessment of changes to individual snow extreme event frequency/magnitude.

Relative sea level projections.description: Data describing relative change in sea level around Canada's coasts.

sea level rise.direction_statement: Relative sea level is expected to rise along many Canadian coastlines.  However, particularly in the North, sea level may actually fall because of ongoing natural land uplift.
sea level rise.direction_confidence: There is reasonably high confidence in the direction of projected sea level changes around Canada's coastlines.
sea level rise.magnitude_confidence: There is less confidence in the exact magnitude of changes to sea level at specific locations.
sea level rise.impact_statement: Via coastal flood events, sea level rise can indundate building interiors, erode foundations and surrounding property, and decrease user accessibility.
sea level rise.notes: Remember, sea level rise will most likely impact your building through it's role in increasing the severity and frequency of storm and tide-driven extreme coastal flooding events.
